==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ひざ|かしら|k2=がしら|r=y}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ひざがしら|膝|tr1=hiza|t1=knee|頭|tr2=kashira|t2=head; top, tip}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=ひざがしら|kashira|gashira}}

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ひざがしら|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ひざがしら}}

# {{lb|ja|anatomy|sort=ひざがしら}} The front of the [[knee]].
# {{lb|ja|anatomy|sort=ひざがしら}} The [[kneecap]], the [[patella]].

====Usage notes====
This term is even more general in meaning than {{m|ja|膝の皿|tr=hiza no sara}} / {{m|ja|膝皿|tr=hiza sara}} or {{m|ja|膝蓋骨|tr=shitsugaikotsu}}.

====Synonyms====
* {{sense|kneecap}} {{ja-r|膝蓋骨|しつがいこつ}}
* {{sense|kneecap}} {{ja-r|膝の皿|ひざ の さら}}
* {{sense|kneecap}} {{ja-r|膝皿|ひざさら}}

====Idioms====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|膝頭で江戸へ行く|ひざがしら で ^えど へ いく}}: "to go to Edo on one's knees" → To rush into something without taking time to prepare, and consequently work harder and get less done in the process.
* {{ja-r|膝頭で箱根は越されぬ|ひざがしら で ^はこね は こされぬ}}: "one cannot get through Hakone (Pass) on one's knees" → To rush into something without taking time to prepare, and consequently work harder and get less done in the process.
